DatasetDict#

Constructor#

DatasetDict

A dictionary (dict of str: datasets.Dataset) with dataset transforms methods (map, filter, etc.)

DatasetDict.from_csv(path_or_paths[,Â ...])

Create [DatasetDict] from CSV file(s).

DatasetDict.from_json(path_or_paths[,Â ...])

Create [DatasetDict] from JSON Lines file(s).

DatasetDict.from_parquet(path_or_paths[,Â ...])

Create [DatasetDict] from Parquet file(s).

DatasetDict.from_text(path_or_paths[,Â ...])

Create [DatasetDict] from text file(s).

Attributes#

DatasetDict.data

The Apache Arrow tables backing each split.

DatasetDict.cache_files

The cache files containing the Apache Arrow table backing each split.

DatasetDict.num_columns

Number of columns in each split of the dataset.

DatasetDict.num_rows

Number of rows in each split of the dataset.

DatasetDict.column_names

Names of the columns in each split of the dataset.

DatasetDict.shape

Shape of each split of the dataset (number of rows, number of columns).

Data processing#

DatasetDict.map([function,Â with_indices,Â ...])

Apply a function to all the examples in the table (individually or in batches) and update the table.

DatasetDict.filter([function,Â with_indices,Â ...])

Apply a filter function to all the elements in the table in batches and update the table so that the dataset only includes examples according to the filter function.

DatasetDict.sort(column_names[,Â reverse,Â ...])

Create a new dataset sorted according to a single or multiple columns.

DatasetDict.shuffle([seeds,Â seed,Â ...])

Create a new Dataset where the rows are shuffled.

DatasetDict.set_format([type,Â columns,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format (type and columns).

DatasetDict.reset_format()

Reset __getitem__ return format to python objects and all columns.

DatasetDict.set_transform(transform[,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format using this transform.

DatasetDict.with_format([type,Â columns,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format (type and columns).

DatasetDict.with_transform(transform[,Â ...])

Set __getitem__ return format using this transform.

DatasetDict.flatten([max_depth])

Flatten the Apache Arrow Table of each split (nested features are flatten).

DatasetDict.cast(features)

Cast the dataset to a new set of features.

DatasetDict.cast_column(column,Â feature)

Cast column to feature for decoding.

DatasetDict.remove_columns(column_names)

Remove one or several column(s) from each split in the dataset and the features associated to the column(s).

DatasetDict.rename_column(...)

Rename a column in the dataset and move the features associated to the original column under the new column name.

DatasetDict.rename_columns(column_mapping)

Rename several columns in the dataset, and move the features associated to the original columns under the new column names.

DatasetDict.select_columns(column_names)

Select one or several column(s) from each split in the dataset and the features associated to the column(s).

DatasetDict.class_encode_column(column[,Â ...])

Casts the given column as [~datasets.features.ClassLabel] and updates the tables.

Serialization / IO#

DatasetDict.save_to_disk(dataset_dict_path)

Saves a dataset dict to a filesystem using fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem.

DatasetDict.load_from_disk(dataset_dict_path)

Load a dataset that was previously saved using [save_to_disk] from a filesystem using fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem.

DatasetDict.push_to_hub(repo_id[,Â ...])

Pushes the [DatasetDict] to the hub as a Parquet dataset.

Caching#

DatasetDict.cleanup_cache_files()

Clean up all cache files in the dataset cache directory, excepted the currently used cache file if there is one.

Metadata#

DatasetDict.align_labels_with_mapping(...)

Align the dataset's label ID and label name mapping to match an input label2id mapping.

previous

datasets.Dataset.align_labels_with_mapping
